name: 蔡佩芳
objective: This course introduces the conceptual and applications oriented understanding in using quantitative analysis and methods in the decision making process. This problem scenario approach describes a problem as an operations research model, which is solved to generate a solution and recommendation to management. Topics covered include linear programming models and its applications, network models and project scheduling, and decision analysis with multiple criteria. Emphasis is placed on the formulations and applications in various settings.
schedule:
Week 1~4 Linear Programming Modeling
Week 5~8 Applications in Operations Management
Week 9 Midterm Exam
Week 10~13 Network Models
Week 14~15 Advanced Models for Multicriteria Decision Problems
Week 16~18 Term Project Discussion
materials: Anderson etal., An Introduction to Management Science: Quantitative Approaches to Decision Making
